itemDescription: Crowe, Sir Edward Thomas Frederick (1877–1960), public servant

wikipedia_page.main: Sir Edward Thomas Frederick Crowe  (20 August 1877 – 8 March 1960) was a senior British civil servant and diplomat.

response: |colspan="4"|Following the unopposed elevation to the Council of Edward Crowe.

Colin Tradescant Crowe was born in Yokohama, Japan, where his father, Edward Crowe (later Sir Edward), also a diplomat, was commercial attaché at the British Embassy. Crowe was educated at Stowe School.

link_mentions.page: List of people educated at Bedford School
response: *Sir Edward Crowe KCMG (1877–1960), Comptroller-General, Department for Overseas Trade, 1928–1937
